content.text:
I'll explore the codebase to understand its structure and get familiar with the project.

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Bash">
<parameter name="command">find "c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master" -maxdepth 2 -type f -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<thinking>
The user wants me to warm up by exploring the codebase. Let me start by understanding the project structure.
</thinking>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Glob">
<parameter name="pattern">c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/**/*.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the basic structure of this repository:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la "c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la "c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">c:/Users/1/Desktop/AutoGPT-master/autogpt_platform/CLAUDE.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Now I have a good understanding of the AutoGPT project. This is the AutoGPT Platform - a visual workflow automation tool that allows users to build AI agents by connecting "blocks" (nodes) together in a graph structure.

Key components I've identified:

1. **autogpt_platform/backend** - Python FastAPI backend with:
   - Block system for modular functionality
   - Graph execution engine
   - Database models using Prisma
   - REST and WebSocket APIs

2. **autogpt_platform/frontend** - Next.js React frontend with:
   - Visual graph editor for building agents
   - Library management
   - Store/marketplace features

3. **autogpt_platform/autogpt_libs** - Shared Python libraries for auth, logging, rate limiting

4. **classic/** - The original AutoGPT implementation (separate from the platform)

The codebase uses:
- **Backend**: Python 3.10+, FastAPI, Prisma ORM, PostgreSQL, Redis
- **Frontend**: TypeScript, Next.js, React, TailwindCSS

I'm ready to help with any planning or exploration tasks for this codebase.
